thread.title: Jefferson Parish Council, Division A: Meet the candidates
thread.title_full: Jefferson Parish Council, Division A: Meet the candidates | NOLA.com

author: Andrea Shaw, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Jefferson Parish Council, Division A: Meet the candidates
text:
Louis Congemi Rick Olivier LOUIS CONGEMI
Personal
www.louiecongemi.com Age 66. Born in New Orleans. Lives in Metairie. Married; two children. Graduate of East Jefferson High School, 1967. Bachelor's degree in education from Loyola University. Semi-retired. Former school teacher. Political
Republican since 1981. Parish Council member, 2004-12. Kenner mayor, 1996-2003. Kenner City Council member, 1982-96. Philosophy
Ensure both sides of Mississippi River have at-large councilman who listens to needs of both constituencies. Work tirelessly to take advantage of improved Huey P. Long Bridge corridor. Bring business leaders, JEDCO and parish administration together to find tenant(s) for Avondale shipyard make it economic engine it once was for entire parish. Continue to work with state and federal legislative delegations to secure important drainage money for projects on both sides of the river. Partner with Jefferson Chamber and tourism leaders to encourage continued growth of wildlife, adventure, cultural and sports-related tourism to benefit of whole parish. Work to finalize lease agreements to maximize Jefferson's financial benefits from West Jefferson Medical Center transaction, find a capable lessee for East Jefferson General Hospital. Jimmy Lawson Jimmy Lawson JIMMY LAWSON
Personal
Age 68. Born in New Orleans. Lives in Gretna. Married; one son. Graduate of West Jefferson High School, 1964. Bachelor's in education, Southeastern Louisiana University. Master's in education administration, Loyola University. Self-employed business consultant. Former teacher at West Jefferson High School and John McDonogh High School, New Orleans. Member, Stonebridge Property Owners Association and PGA of America. Political
Lifelong Democrat. Parish Council member, 1976-96; lost 2nd District election, 1995. School Board member, 1972-76. Member, Jefferson Parish Housing Authority. Worked on campaigns of Jim Donelon, Robert Billiot, Rodney Camardelle, T.J. "Butch'' Ward, John Young, Aaron Broussard, Paul Johnston and Ray St. Pierre. Philosophy
Transparency and civility in conduct of all council actions. Abolish executive sessions, unless advised otherwise by legal counsel. Fiscal accountability and conservative fiscal expenditures. Economic development and responsible urban planning. Metropolitan cooperation in transportation and tourism. Chris Roberts Chris Roberts CHRIS ROBERTS
Personal
Age 38. Born in New Orleans. Lives in Harvey. Divorced; three children. Graduate of Archbishop Shaw High School, 1995. Bachelor's degree in marketing from Our Lady of Holy Cross College. Member of Our Lady of Holy Cross Advisory Council, Knights of Columbus, West Bank Optimist Club. Political
Republican since 2009. Parish Council member, 2004-present. School Board member, 1999-2003. Worked on campaigns of Arthur Lawson, Bobby Jindal, Paul Connick Jr., Newell Normand Robert Wolfe, Jonathan Liberto and Bryan Adams. Philosophy
Bring efficiency to the Department of Code Enforcement. Restructure Housing Authority. Finalize lease transaction between West Jefferson Medical Center and Louisiana Children's Medical Center. Work on long-term solution to stabilize East Jefferson General Hospital. Continue to provide law enforcement the tools needed to be effective.
